PN.content:
Please identify the "Property Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: [9][10][11] One of the most powerful and flexible strategies to design low band gap conjugated polymers involves an alternating sequence of electron - donor ( D ) and electron - acceptor ( A ) moieties along the conjugated polymer main chain.

Let's think step by step.

1. electron - donor (D): This is a property name referring to a moiety (a part of a molecule) that can donate electrons.
2. electron - acceptor (A): This is a property name referring to a moiety (a part of a molecule) that can accept electrons.
3. band gap: This is a property name referring to the energy difference between the conduction band and the valence band in a semiconductor material. In this context, it is mentioned in relation to conjugated polymers, which are known for their ability to have low band gaps.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Property.

1. band gap: This is a material property referring to the energy difference between the conduction band and the valence band in a semiconductor material. In this context, it is mentioned in relation to conjugated polymers.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.
